result.execSummary:
The defendant Dameon P Reynosa was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Dameon P Reynosa is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Dameon P Reynosa was found guilty of Battery to Injunction Petitioner [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.20(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Provide a DNA sample; pay all fees associated. Pay all costs, surcharges and supervision fees.

- No contact with firearms, and no weapons ever. Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the No Contact Order and due to this DV conviction he may never possess firearms or ammunition. Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he must provide a DNA sample, his voting rights are suspended and he may never possess firearms.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
- No further violations of the law.
- Complete Batterer's Intervnetion program.
- Parenting classes.
- AODA assessment; comply with any treatment.
- Maintain absolute sobriety; random urine screens.
- Attend treatment and/or counseling as determined.
- No Contact with victim.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Dameon P Reynosa

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Dameon P Reynosa in court with attorney Kiley Zellner.  Defendant Dameon P Reynosa in custody.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.   State advised the Court they have complied with the Victims' Rights Law.  Court sentenced defendant to serve a Term of Imprisonment of 3 YEARS in the Wisconsin State Prison, consecutive to any other sentence; credit for 147 days served.  Court ordered 1.5 YEARS Initial Term Of Confinement and 1.5 YEARS Extended Supervision.
Court found defendant not eligible for Challenge Incarceration or Earned Release Programs.

Conditions of Extended Supervision:
- No further violations of the law.
- Complete batterer's intervention program.
- Parenting classes.
- AODA assessment; comply with any treatment.
- Maintain absolute sobriety; random urine screens.
- Attend treatment and/or counseling as determined.
- No contact with victim.
- No contact with firearms, and no weapons ever.
- Pay all costs, surcharges and supervision fees.
- Provide a DNA sample and pay all fees associated.

 
Received and filed: Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence. 
Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction he may never possess firearms or ammunition.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he must provide a DNA sample, his voting rights are suspended and he may never possess firearms.

Attorney Kiley Zellner in court, defendant Dameon P Reynosa not in court, in custody.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Case set for sentencing.  Court and ADA Schrank are in trial.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 25, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Dameon P Reynosa in court with attorney Kiley Zellner.  Defendant Dameon P Reynosa in custody.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
AS TO COUNT 1:  On motion of the state, Court ordered Count 1 dismissed.
.
AS TO COUNTS 2,4 AND 5:  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of State, Court ordered charges dismissed.  
.
AS TO COUNT 3:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 40.  Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 22, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
2nd Amended Information received and filed.   rmm
received and filed.  rmm

from the state received and filed.  rmm

Defendant Dameon P Reynosa in court with attorney Kiley Zellner.  Defendant Dameon P Reynosa in custody.  Michael Christopher Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Final Pretrial held.  Case remains set for jury trial on 6/22/15 in Branch 40.  Court reminds defendant the no contact order remains in effect.
from the defense received and filed.  rmm
from the defense received and filed.  rmm
Defendant enters a SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND.

Defendant Dameon P Reynosa in court with attorney Kiley Zellner.  Defendant Dameon P Reynosa in custody.  Michael Christopher Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.    Court took judicial notice of certified documents regarding case #12FA3022.  Sworn for the state:  City of Milwaukee Police Officer Randy Wesley.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Final pre-trial scheduled for May 29, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for June 22, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Shaquana H

Defendant Dameon P Reynosa in court with attorney Alexis Liggins.  Defendant Dameon P Reynosa in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dallet, Branch 40. Defense moves to Dismiss Count 2.  Arguments heard.  Court DENIES motion to dismiss.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  Defense entered a plea of NOT GUILTY as to Counts 4 & 5.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  

Commissioner advised DNA sample has not obtained from the Defendant.   Court ordered the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department to collect a sample.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wis. Stats. Section 165.77(4).

  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 14, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
